intro: Silene sendtneri subsp. balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan campion, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink or white flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is found in mountainous regions. It has small, ovate leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Silene sendtneri subsp. balcanica is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
